frameset.note: Frames file for "offer" based on first hundred or so instances in big corpus

roleset.name: transaction

roles.note: This actually conflates two senses, the "buy" sense and the "sell" sense. In the "buy" sense you offer cash for some commodity; in the "sell" sense you offer some commodity and hope to get some cash for it. Thus the "direct object" will vary between Arg1 and Arg2.

example.name: ditransitive
example.text: A solicitous Christian chauffeur offers the hero God's phone number.

example.name: PP benefactive
example.text: A solicitous Christian chauffeur offers God's phone number to the hero.

example.name: cash as direct object
example.text: Temple offered $50 million for Sea Containers

example.name: for-phrase as price
example.text: The company offers a word-processing package for $100.

example.name: for-phrase included in commodity
example.text: The company offers a word-processing package for personal computers.
example.arg: a word-processing package for personal computers

example.name: arg1 as infinitive
example.text: New England Electric offered $2 billion to acquire PS of New Hampshire.
example.arg: to acquire PS of New Hampshire

example.name: contrasting with above
example.text: New England Electric offered $2 billion for PS of New Hampshire.

example.name: another arg1 as infinitive
example.text: Fujitsu essentially offered *trace* to do it for free.

roleset.note: Theoretically also with benefactive (but I doubt we'll see any):

example.name: benefactive direct object
example.text: John offered Mary to rub her shoulders
